intro: Maihueniopsis wagenknechtii, commonly known as the Andean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
